Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; cream slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; lotus flower in added white and added red; top of rim black; exterior: frieze of dots at top of rim; broken maeander pattern between pairs of narrow black bands; below, vertical tongue pattern, some black, some reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Brussels III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Belgique (p. 2, pl. 3, no. 3a-3b)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 307, no. 1234)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2011) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Purchased in Cairo by M. Jean de Mot
